body_html:
Run bazel build -c opt tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo once manually. This will initialize the bazel-tensorflow directory that Gradle is looking for the model files in. After that you'll be able to build normally with Android Studio.

There's a fix pending to make this work in a more generic fashion without needing Bazel.
body_text:
Run bazel build -c opt tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo once manually. This will initialize the bazel-tensorflow directory that Gradle is looking for the model files in. After that you'll be able to build normally with Android Studio.
There's a fix pending to make this work in a more generic fashion without needing Bazel.
body:
Run `bazel build -c opt tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo` once manually. This will initialize the bazel-tensorflow directory that Gradle is looking for the model files in. After that you'll be able to build normally with Android Studio.

There's a fix pending to make this work in a more generic fashion without needing Bazel.
